docs.lead_paragraph: The life insurance companies MetLife and Prudential Financial said on Wednesday that profits fell in the fourth quarter, hurt by investment losses and, in MetLife’s case, comparison with a large investment gain a year ago.

headline.main: MetLife and Prudential Post Lower Profits

docs.snippet: The life insurance companies MetLife and Prudential Financial said on Wednesday that profits fell in the fourth quarter, hurt by investment losses and, in MetLife’s case, comparison with a large investment gain a year ago.

docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — The Cigna Corporation, a health insurer, said on Wednesday that fourth-quarter profit rose 13 percent as growth in its overseas business and in its group disability and life operations helped to offset a slight decline in health care earnings.

headline.main: Cigna’s Profit Rises on Overseas Business

headline.main: Diabetes Study Partially Halted After Deaths

docs.lead_paragraph: The company will announce Thursday plans for several hundred new clinics at its stores, using a standardized format and jointly branded with hospitals and medical groups.

docs.lead_paragraph: Medical tourism has been an increasingly popular alternative for the uninsured desperate for care, and for middle-class Americans willing to travel to secure affordable health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: As we've written before, the business of catching a falling knife is likely to leave serious gashes. And since December, Warburg Pincus, the respected private equity firm, is continuing to get cut by its investment in MBIA.

headline.main: Warburg Pincus' Nonstop Pain at MBIA

docs.lead_paragraph: Commercial and investment banks could see their credit ratings cut if the bond insurers that hedge some of their assets were themselves downgraded, Standard & Poor's said on Tuesday, as billionaire investor Wilbur Ross mulled whether to invest $1 billion or more in the sector.

headline.main: S.&P. Warns on Banks' Exposure to Bond Insurers

docs.abstract: Commercial and investment banks could see their credit ratings cut if the bond insurers that hedge some of their assets were themselves downgraded, Standard & Poor's said on Tuesday, as billionaire investor Wilbur Ross mulled whether to invest $1 billion or more in the sector. docs.lead_paragraph: NEW HAVEN - Dominique Lomack walked into the cafeteria at the High School in the Community here at lunchtime on Tuesday with a blank look on her face. She is only in 10th grade, but her youth did not spare her from the singular question haunting Democrats in these parts.

headline.main: On Today's Lunch Menu, the Students Can Choose

docs.abstract: Students voted in a mock presidential primary in the cafeteria of the High School in the Community in New Haven.
